SEARCH
Module UsefulSchoolPortal
Package files

Class DataManagement

java.lang.Object
files.DataManagement
public class DataManagement extends Object
The DataManagement class is the transition point between static data entered in the program and object data created from files. Object data is obtained from the objects in this class and are transferred to the graphics classes, which can only take information from static methods.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Daniel Santillan

    DataManagement()
    An empty constructor

      public static void setup()
      The setup method instantiates the lists and reads the school file found in FileWorker to add every school in data to the schools ArrayList.

      Returns:

    • addNewAdministrator

      public static boolean addNewAdministrator(String username, String firstName, String lastName, String password)
      The addNewAdministrator method adds a new administrator to a school system without logging in the user to the system. This must be done after a school system has been created in the program.
      Parameters:
      username - The given username
      firstName - The given first name
      lastName - The given last name
      password - The given password
      Returns:
      Whether or not everything was successful

    • addSchoolAndAdministrator

      public static boolean addSchoolAndAdministrator(String schoolName, String adminUsername, String adminFirstName, String adminLastName, String adminPassword)
      The addSchoolAndAdministrator method adds a new school to the system and adds the new administrator as well using the addNewSchoolAdministrator method. This is used when a new school is registered to the program.
      Parameters:
      schoolName - The given school name
      adminUsername - The given admin username
      adminFirstName - The given admin first name
      adminLastName - The given admin last name
      adminPassword - The given admin password
      Returns:
      Whether or not everything worked

    • getGradingMethod

      public static int getGradingMethod(int classID)
      The getGradingMethod method searches for a class by given ID and returns that class's grading method, which is an integer representation defined in the Constants class. -1 is returned if there is no class with the ID.
      Parameters:
      classID - The classID to search for
      Returns:
      The grading method used by the class.

    • setGradingMethod

      public static boolean setGradingMethod(int classID, int gradingMethod)
      The setGradingMethod method searches for a class by given ID and gives it a new grading method, which is passed in to the method. All existing assignments are deleted, and the class's information is modified on data.
      Parameters:
      classID - The classID to search for
      gradingMethod - The grading method to set it to
      Returns:
      Whether or not the grading method was set

      public static int getLoggedInUserRole()
      The getLoggedInUserRole method gets the role of the logged in user. This is either administrator, teacher, or student.
      Returns:
      The user's role in an integer representation defined in Constants

      Returns:
      The logged in user

      public static void logOutUser()

    • refactorUser

      public static boolean refactorUser(String username, String firstName, String lastName, String password, int id)
      The refactorUser method edits a user. If a user is editing their name or password, the user is searched by ID and then is changed based on a method from the School class, which will accordingly rewrite data. If nothing is given for fields, the field remains the same.
      Parameters:
      username - The given username
      firstName - The given first name
      lastName - The given last name
      password - The given password
      id - The user ID
      Returns:
      Whether the user was successfuly edited

    • refactorYourself

      public static boolean refactorYourself(String username, String firstName, String lastName, String password)
      The refactorYourself method refactors the user logged in. It returns the result of refactorUser with the user ID being the logged in user's ID.
      Parameters:
      username - The given username
      firstName - The given first name
      lastName - The given last name
      password - The given password
      Returns:
      Whether the user was successfully edited

    • changePassword

      public static boolean changePassword(String password)
      The changePassword method uses the refactorUser method to change the password of a user. This is used for users who can only change their passwords.
      Parameters:
      password - The given password
      Returns:
      Whether the password was successfully changed

    • setBlocks

      public static void setBlocks(int blocks)
      The setBlocks method sets the number of blocks a school has. If there is a class that is not in the range of blocks, that class is deleted.
      Parameters:
      blocks - The number of blocks a school implements

    • getBlocks

      public static int getBlocks()

    • manageStudentInClass

      public static void manageStudentInClass(int classID, int studentID, boolean alreadyAdded)
      The manageStudentInClass method either adds or removes a student from a particular class. If an administrator tries to add a student to a particular class in a block where the student already has a class, the code will prevent the administrator from adding the student.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the class to add to/delete from
      studentID - The student ID of the student to be managed
      alreadyAdded - Whether the student is already in the class

    • manageTeacherInClass

      public static void manageTeacherInClass(int classID, int teacherID, boolean alreadyAdded)
      The manageTeacherInClass method either adds or removes a teacher from a particular class. If an administrator tries to add a teacher to a particular class in a block where the teacher already has a class, the code will prevent the administrator from adding the teacher.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the class to add to/delete from
      teacherID - The teacher ID of the student to be managed
      alreadyAdded - Whether the student is already in the class

    • getCurrentUserClasses

      public static ArrayList<SchoolClass> getCurrentUserClasses()
      The getCurrentUserClasses method searches for the list of classes the logged in user is in and returns that list.
      Returns:
      The list of classes the current user is a part of

      classID - The class ID of the class with the announcement

      public static String getAnnouncement(int classID)

      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the class with the announcement
      Returns:
      The class's announcement

    • getWeightCategories

      public static ArrayList<String> getWeightCategories(int classID)
      The getWeightCategoriesMethod searches for a particular class by ID and returns its list of weight categories. This only applies to assignments in classes that use the weight grading system. If nothing is found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the class with the desired weight categories
      Returns:
      The class's list of weight categories

    • getIndividualAssignmentWeightCategory

      public static String getIndividualAssignmentWeightCategory(int classID, int assignmentID)
      The getIndividualAssignmentWeightCategory method searches for a particular assignment by its class ID and assignment ID and returns the weight category it is in. This only applies to assignments in classes that use the weight grading system. If nothing is found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the assignment
      assignmentID - The assignment's ID
      Returns:
      The weight category

    • getIndividualAssignmentPoints

      public static int getIndividualAssignmentPoints(int classID, int assignmentID)
      The getIndividualAssignmentPoints method searches for a particular assignment by its class ID and assignment ID and returns the number of points the assignment is worth. This only applies to assignments in classes that use the points grading system. If nothing is found, a negative value is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the assignment
      assignmentID - The assignment's ID
      Returns:
      The number of points the assignment is worth

    • getWeightPercents

      public static ArrayList<Integer> getWeightPercents(int classID)
      The getWeightPercents method searches for a particular class by its class ID and returns its weight percents. This only applies to classes that use the weights grading system. If nothing is found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID of the assignment
      Returns:
      The list of weight percents in the class

    • getWeightPercentByCategory

      public static int getWeightPercentByCategory(int classID, String weight)
      The getWeightPercentByCategory method searches for a particular class by its class ID and returns the weight percent of a particular weight, given in a parameter. This only applies to classes that use the weights grading system. If nothing is found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      weight - The weight
      Returns:
      The percent of the weight

    • setWeights

      public static void setWeights(ArrayList<String> categories, ArrayList<Integer> percents, int classID)
      The setWeights method searches for a particular class by its class ID and sets the class's weights to the given categories and percents.
      Parameters:
      categories - The list of weight categories
      percents - The list of weight percents
      classID - The class ID of the class with new weights

    • addAssignment

      public static void addAssignment(int classID, String name, int points)
      The addAssignment method adds an assignment to a class based on the class ID. The assignment receives a name and a particular number of points.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      name - The name of the assignment
      points - The number of points the assignment is worth

    • addAssignment

      public static void addAssignment(int classID, String name, String weightCategory)
      The addAssignment method adds an assignment to a class based on the class ID. The assignment recieves a name and a weight category.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      name - The name of the assignment
      weightCategory - The weight category the assignment belongs to

    • addAssignment

      public static void addAssignment(int classID, String name)
      The addAssignment method adds an assignment to a class based on the class ID. The assignment receives a name.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      name - The name of the assignment

    • modifyAssignment

      public static void modifyAssignment(int classID, int assignmentID, String name, int points)
      The modifyAssignment method modifies an already existing assignment in a class that uses the points grading system. These modifications can include a name change or a change in the number of points the assignment is worth.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      assignmentID - The assignment ID
      name - The new name
      points - The new points value

    • modifyAssignment

      public static void modifyAssignment(int classID, int assignmentID, String name, String weightCategory)
      The modifyAssignment method modifies an already existing assignment in a class that uses the weights grading system. These modifications can include a name change or a change in the weight category.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      assignmentID - The assignment ID
      name - The new name
      weightCategory - The new weight category

    • modifyAssignment

      public static void modifyAssignment(int classID, int assignmentID, String name)
      The modifyAssignment method modifies an already existing assignment in a class that uses a basic percents grading system. This modification can include a name change.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      assignmentID - The assignment ID
      name - The new name

    • deleteAssignment

      public static void deleteAssignment(int classID, int assignmentID)
      The deleteAssignment method deletes an assignment in a class by ID.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      assignmentID - The assignment ID

    • getGrades

      public static ArrayList<Double> getGrades(int classID, int assignmentID)
      The getGrades method returns the grades of each student in a class's assignment. If the class or assignment cannot be found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      assignmentID - The assignment ID
      Returns:
      The list of grades for every student

    • getIndividualStudentAssignmentGrades

      public static ArrayList<Double> getIndividualStudentAssignmentGrades(int classID, int studentID)
      The getIndividualStudentAssignmentGrades method return the grades of each assignment for one student in a class. If the student or class cannot be found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      studentID - The student ID
      Returns:
      The list of assignment grades

    • getIndividualStudentAverage

      public static double getIndividualStudentAverage(int classID, int studentID)
      The getIndividualStudentAverage method returns the class average for an individual student in a class. If the student or class cannot be found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      studentID - The student ID
      Returns:
      The average

    • getAllAverages

      public static ArrayList<Double> getAllAverages(int classID)
      The getAllAverages method returns every student's class average in a class. If the class cannot be found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      Returns:
      The list of averages

    • setGrades

      public static void setGrades(int classID, int assignmentID, ArrayList<Double> grades)
      The setGrades method sets the grades for every student in a particular assignment (after the teacher confirms the gradebook, which can be edited at any time).
      Parameters:
      classID - The class ID
      assignmentID - The assignment ID
      grades - The list of grades to add

    • addInfraction

      public static void addInfraction(String name, int studentID, String reason)
      The addInfraction method adds an infraction to the school's infraction database. An infraction includes a name, student ID, and reason. The staff ID of the infraction (see Infraction class) is set by the logged in user's ID.
      Parameters:
      name - The given infraction name
      studentID - The given student ID
      reason - The given reason

    • modifyInfraction

      public static void modifyInfraction(String name, int infractionID, int studentID, String reason)
      The modifyInfraction method modifies an infraction. Modifications can include name, who the student being infracted is, and reason.
      Parameters:
      name - The given infraction name
      infractionID - The infraction ID
      studentID - The given student ID
      reason - the given reason

    • deleteInfraction

      public static void deleteInfraction(int infractionID)
      The deleteInfraction method deletes an infraction.
      Parameters:
      infractionID - The infraction ID

    • getInfractionsByUser

      public static ArrayList<Infraction> getInfractionsByUser(int userID)
      The getInfractionsByUser method returns the list of infractions that involve a particular user. The user can either be the person infracting or the person infracted.
      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID
      Returns:
      The list of infractions the user is involved in

    • getCurrentSchoolInfractions

      public static ArrayList<Infraction> getCurrentSchoolInfractions()
      The getCurrentSchoolInfractions method returns the infractions in a school system.
      Returns:
      The full list of infractions

    • getNameByID

      public static String getNameByID(int id)
      The getNameByID method returns a user's name based on their user ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The user ID
      Returns:
      The user's name

      This is the toString method for this class.
